page.title: 02BLEAK HOUSE PENRITH
page.content: Bleak House Caravan Site is occupied by council tenants and travellers.The council tenants live at Bleak House because there are no available council houses(the council tenants use the address "Lakeland View")for a year or more until the council can find them a house.The rent per week is low.Only Â£9.50 but the electicity(40p a day) and the gas(Â£12.00 a bottle)is enough to make the amount per week living in a caravan high.The caravans are slightly bigger than ordinary caravans used for holidays,but it is still small for a family of five to live in.There are two bedrooms,one with a double bed in it and one with two bunks in.The kitchen and dining room are in the same area with an archway leading to the lounge.There is a toilet and a shower in the caravan but they are still very small and cramped.
